_field_short_enum.name: highest prop class^#The prop class that this block is describing

item.Name: none - actor has no targets whatsoever
dead enemy- my only target is a dead enemy
non-attacking enemy- I am debilitated and the enemy is not attacking me
disregarded orphan- did not find my target and gave up searching
inspected orphan- checked last know position and didn't find target; still searching
uninspected orphan- can't see target, but have a good idea where they may be
certain orphan- can't see target, but know exactly where they are
visible enemy- I can see the target
nearby enemy- I can see the target, and it's close
potentially dangerous enemy- target is near and is facing me
dangerous enemy- target is facing my way and fighting
attacking enemy- target is aiming at me and shooting me
very close enemy- enemy is really close

perceived danger decay half-life:seconds#How many seconds until it decays to half between its current and target values

hard ping threshold (with shields)# THIS IS NOW AN ABSOLUTE VALUE, NOT A FRACTION: damage necessary to trigger a hard ping when shields are up
hard ping threshold (no shields)#THIS IS NOW AN ABSOLUTE VALUE, NOT A FRACTION: damage necessary to trigger a hard ping when shields are down

body recharge time#amount of time for shields to recharge completely
shield recharge delay time#amount of time delay before a shield begins to recharge
shield recharge time#amount of time for shields to recharge completely
extended shield damage threshold:%#Amount of shield damage sustained before it is considered 'extended'
extended body damage threshold:%#Amount of body damage sustained before it is considered 'extended'
suicide radius#when I die and explode, I damage stuff within this distance of me.

_field_block_64._field_explanation: These values govern how we should avoid danger zones (like grenades and vehicles). If their sum is less than 1 then neither action will occur and instead we'll just try to walk out of the way with that remaining probability.

_field_real.name: armor lock chance#Chance the AI will use their armor lock equipment, assuming they have it
grenade stuck armor lock chance#Chance the AI will use their armor lock equipment if they have been stuck with a grenade, assuming they have it
armor lock safety duration#The number of seconds we will stay in armor lock for after danger has passed (default 1 second)
armor lock max duration#The longest we will stay in armor lock for regardless of danger (default 5 seconds)
armor lock cooldown#We won't go into armor lock again for this many seconds (default 0 seconds)
dive grenade chance#One die roll is used for both this and brace. (dive < roll)
brace grenade chance#This is the probability beyond dive. (dive + brace < roll)
dive vehicle chance#One die roll is used for both this and brace. (dive < roll)
brace vehicle chance#This is the probability beyond dive. (dive + brace < roll)

_field_short_enum.name: obstacle leap min size
obstacle leap max size
obstacle ignore size
obstacle smashable size
jump height

_field_real.name: max jump height#Max height of any jump hint (in world units). Set to 0 for no effect.
max jump distance#Max distance of any jump hint (in world units). Set to 0 for no effect
maximum leap height:wus#.How high can a crate be for this unit to leap it.
leap proximity fraction:[0-1]#How close to the obstacle should the actor be before leaping 1- too close, 0- as soon as he becomes aware of it
avoidance volume turn penalty distance:wus#The maximum distance penalty applied to an avoidance volume search path if we're facing away from the path. 1000 wu good for space, 5 wu good for ground.

_field_long_integer.name: minimum movement ticks:ticks#We will move at least this long in a single direction when starting movement

_field_real.name: minimum movement ticks reset angle:degrees#If the character changes movement direction by more than this angle, he will have to move for at least minimum movement ticks until he can change his mind.

_field_block_64.name: change direction pause
_field_block_64._field_explanation: These values tell the actor to remain stationary for the specified number of ticks if he changes his direction of movement by at least 'change angle'. Specifying an angle of 0 means pause this much every time you get to your destination.

_field_angle.name: direction change angle:degrees

_field_real.name: maximum throttle:[0-1]#The character will never throttle beyond this value
minimum throttle:[0-1]#The character will not throttle below this value

_field_short_enum.name: combat status#When combat status is bigger or equal to this combat status, use the throttle settings below.

_field_real.name: distance:wus#If AI needs to move at greater or equal to this distance, they will move at the given throttle
throttle scale:[0-1]#Throttle scale between minimum and maximum throttle
minimum juke throttle:[0-1]#The character will consider juking at this throttle and above

_field_angle.name: minimum direction change juke angle:deg#If we change movement direction by more this angle, we will attempt a juke

_field_real.name: non direction change juke probability#Probability to do a juke for a given tick, even if you are not planning to change direction (and provided you have not already performed a juke within the timeout time

non direction change juke timeout:seconds#After you do a change or no change of direction juke, you cannot perform a NON directional change juke for at least this many seconds. Direction change jukes will still happen

_field_long_integer.name: minimum post juke movement ticks:ticks#How many ticks should the actor keep moving after a juke? This may lower juke frequency.

_field_real.name: stationary turn radius:[wu]#If this actor translates during turn animations, enter a radius that encloses the translation.
localized move distance:[wu]#Distance to move as per the move_localized firing position evaluator (0 value resolves to 5wu)

_field_real_bounds.name: move distance:[wu]#Distance to move as per the move_distance firing position evaluator (0 value resolves to 5wu for min, 10wu for max)
vehicle move distance:[wu]#Distance to move as per the vehicle_move_distance firing position evaluator (0 value resolves to 5wu for min, 10wu for max)

_field_real.name: turn and run distance from target:wus#Actor will face away from his target and run to his destination if his target at a larger distance than this
turn and run distance to destination:wus#Firing point must be at least this distance away from the actor for him to consider turning and running to it

follow unit buffer distance:wus#When following a unit, such as the player, this is the additional buffer outside of the task follow radius that we are allowed to position ourselves before full firing position avoidance kicks in
phase chance
phase delay seconds#don't attempt again before given time since last phase

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Characters using composite animations can choose to align their facing with their aim-target or their destination. These settings control how the facing is determined.

_field_real.name: Departure Distance Min#min distance from departure point where facing should be aligned with aim
Departure Distance Range#max distance from departure point where facing should be aligned with heading
Arrival Distance Min#min distance from destination point where facing should be aligned with aim
Arrival Distance Range#max distance from destination point where facing should be aligned with heading

_field_angle.name: Maximum Deviation Angle#how far we will allow the facing to deviate from the preference.

_field_struct.name: smooth throttle#Allows characters to be smooth throttle changes.

_field_block_64._field_explanation: The following setting are applied when the Override option is chosen

_field_real.name: Starting Rate:(0.0 to 1.0)#interpolation weight used for the first frame of movement from a stopped position.
Stopping Rate:(0.0 to 1.0)#interpolation weight used for transitioning to a zero (stopped) throttle.
Max Linear Acceleration:throttle units per second#maximum linear acceleration limit for throttle magnitude during regular movement.
Max Linear Deceleration:throttle units per second#maximum linear deceleration limit for throttle magnitude during regular movement.

_field_angle.name: Max Angular Acceleration:degrees per second#maximum angular acceleration/deceleration limit for throttle changes.

_field_real.name: Max Reversal Linear Acceleration:throttle units per second#maximum linear Accel/Decel limit for throttle magnitude when reversing direction.

_field_angle.name: Max Reversal Angular Acceleration:degrees per second#maximum angular Accel/Decel limit for throttle heading when reversing direction.

_field_struct.name: locomotion settings#Controls how the throttle changes along a path.

_field_real_fraction.name: Sharp Turn Throttle:(0.0 to 1.0)#lowest throttle to use when passing through a sharp turn

_field_angle.name: Sharp Turn Angle#angle that denotes a sharp turn

_field_real.name: Max Accel Time#seconds to go from 0 to full throttle.
Max Decel Time#seconds to go from full throttle to 0.
wall climb cost multiplier # values below 1.0 will cause the character to prefer to path along wals. Tune carefully.
bound forward distance# Total distance character will bound forward to shortcut path.
bound forward sidestep# Distance character moves to the side during bounding.

_field_real.name: Crouch danger threshold#When danger rises above the threshold, the actor crouches

_field_real.name: minimum throw distance#Targets closer than this distance will not be attacked with a throw
maximum throw distance#Targets beyond this distance will not be attacked with a throw

_field_real.name: Berserk melee cooldown:sec#Should generally be set to 0.0 unless 'permanent berserk once initiated' is checked
Berserk melee abort range:units#Should generally be set to 0.0 (unlimited range) unless 'permanent berserk once initiated' is checked
Beserk cooldown:seconds#Time that I will stay in beserk after losing my target, and then revert back to normal

proximity berserk range:world units#If our target is closer than this distance, and not (in a vehicle/larger size than us/using a melee weapon), we will berserk. If our target is further than this distance, we will stop berserking. Set to 0 to disable proximity berserking.
proximity berserk outside fp range:world units#We will never go more than this far outside our firing point areas when proximity-berserking. 0= no limit.

_field_real_fraction.name: proximity berserk chance:[0,1]#If we have a target close enough to berserk, this is the chance that we will do so. If chance fails, we will try again after timeout.

_field_real.name: proximity berserk timeout:seconds#We will not proximity-berserk unless it has been at least this long since we last stopped berserking. 0= no timeout.
Broken kamikaze chance#Probability that I will run the kamikaze behaviour when my leader dies.
Perimeter Range#How far we will melee charge outside our firing points before starting perimeter (defaults to 5wu)
Perimeter Range Close#How far we will melee charge outside our firing points before starting perimeter when the target is close to me (within 3wu) (defaults to 9wu)
Perimeter Damage Timeout:secs#How long will we take damage from our target before either seeking cover or berserking (defaults to 3secs)
Max target scariness#Maximum scariness value of the target for allowing a charge attack.

_field_real.name: Evasion danger threshold#Consider evading when immediate danger surpasses threshold
Evasion delay timer#Wait at least this delay between evasions
Evasion chance#If danger is above threshold, the chance that we will evade. Expressed as chance of evading within a 1 second time period
Evasion proximity threshold#If target is within given proximity, possibly evade

_field_block_64.name: cover properties

_field_real_bounds.name: hide behind cover time:seconds#how long we stay behind cover after seeking cover

_field_block_64._field_explanation: The following fields dictate how hologram equipment is used by AI in cover.

_field_real_bounds.name: hologram cover wait time:seconds#how long we wait in cover before using the hologram

_field_real.name: hologram cooldown delay:seconds#Amount of time I will wait before trying to use hologram equipment again (0 value defaults to 5 seconds)

_field_block_64._field_explanation: The following fields dictate the conditions under which we will go into cover.

_field_real.name: Cover shield fraction#Only cover when shield falls below this level
Cover vitality threshold#Only cover when vitality falls below this level
Cover danger threshold#Danger must be this high to cover.
minimum defensive distance from target:wus#How far from the target should we switch from aggresive to defensive covering (0 always defensive, big number always offensive)
minimum defensive distance from cover:wus#If our cover point is less than this distance, we will never consider defensive covering
always defensive scary threshold#If the target has scarines bigger or equal to this, we will always cover defensively
Cover check delay:seconds#Amount of time I will wait before trying again after covering (0 value defaults to 2 seconds)
Cover pinned down check delay:seconds#Amount of time I will wait before issuing a pinned down message (0 value defaults to 2 seconds)
Emerge from cover when shield fraction reaches threshold#Emerge from cover when shield fraction reaches threshold
Proximity self-preserve:wus#Triggers self-preservation when target within this distance (assuming proximity_self_preserve_impulse is enabled)
proximity melee distance#When self preserving from a target less than given distance, causes melee attack (assuming proximity_melee_impulse is enabled)
unreachable enemy danger threshold#When danger from an unreachable enemy surpasses threshold, actor cover (assuming unreachable_enemy_cover impulse is enabled)
unassailable enemy danger threshold#When target is unassailable, and danger goes over this value - cover (assuming unassailable_enemy_cover impulse is enabled)
scary target threshold#When target is aware of me and surpasses the given scariness, self-preserve (assuming scary_target_cover_impulse is enabled)

Vitality fraction shield equipment{Vitality fraction bubbleshield}#Fraction of vitality below which an equipped shield equipment (instant cover/bubbleshield) will be activated (once damage has died down, and assuming shield_equipment_impulse is enabled)
Recent damage shield equipment#Must have less than this amount of recent body damage before we can deploy our equipped shield equipment.
Minimum enemy distance#Minimum distance to enemy before we are forced to break out of cover
Shield threshold#When shield vitality drops below given amount, retreat is triggered by low_shield_retreat_impulse
Scary target threshold#When confronting an enemy of over the given scariness, retreat is triggered by scary_target_retreat_impulse
Danger threshold#When perceived danger rises above the given threshold, retreat is triggered by danger_retreat_impulse
Proximity threshold#When enemy closer than given threshold, retreat is triggered by proximity_retreat_impulse

peer dead retreat chance#If peer-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when one of our peers (friend of the same race) dies within 4 world units of us
second peer dead retreat chance#If peer-dead-retreat-impulse is active, gives the chance that we will flee when a second peer (friend of the same race) dies within 4 world units of us

_field_block_64._field_explanation: For vocalization with priority < react, multiplies the skip fraction in the dialogue globals tag. For priorities > react, multiplies the vocalization WEIGHT (i.e. the desire of that character to vocalize RELATIVE to other characters in the scene). Thus if you hurt the arbiter, say, he's still going to yell at you, no matter what, and if you kill somebody and nobody else is there to witness it, he will yell at you. As always, 0 means speak normally, 1 means skip everything (don't say lindquist)

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Parameters control how accuracy changes over the duration of a series of bursts Accuracy is an analog value between 0 and 1. At zero, the parameters of the first firing-pattern block is used. At 1, the parameters in the second block is used. In between, all the values are linearly interpolated

_field_real_bounds.name: normal accuracy bounds#Indicates starting and ending accuracies at normal difficulty

_field_real.name: normal accuracy time#The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

_field_real_bounds.name: heroic accuracy bounds#Indicates starting and ending accuracies at heroic difficulty

_field_real.name: heroic accuracy time#The amount of time it takes the accuracy to go from starting to ending

_field_real_bounds.name: legendary accuracy bounds#Indicates starting and ending accuracies at legendary difficulty

_field_block_64.name: firing patterns

_field_real.name: rate of fire#how many times per second we pull the trigger (zero = continuously held down)
target tracking:[0,1]#how well our bursts track moving targets. 0.0= fire at the position they were standing when we started the burst. 1.0= fire at current position
target leading:[0,1]#how much we lead moving targets. 0.0= no prediction. 1.0= predict completely.

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
at the start of every burst we pick a random point near the target to fire at, on either the left or the right side. the burst origin angle controls whether this error is exactly horizontal or might have some vertical component.
over the course of the burst we move our projectiles back in the opposite direction towards the target. this return motion is also controlled by an angle that specifies how close to the horizontal it is.
for example if the burst origin angle and the burst return angle were both zero, and the return length was the same as the burst length, every burst would start the same amount away from the target (on either the left or right) and move back to exactly over the target at the end of the burst.

_field_real.name: burst origin radius:world units#how far away from the target the starting point is

_field_angle.name: burst origin angle:degrees#the range from the horizontal that our starting error can be

_field_real_bounds.name: burst return length:world units#how far the burst point moves back towards the target (could be negative)

_field_angle.name: burst return angle:degrees#the range from the horizontal that the return direction can be

_field_real_bounds.name: burst duration:seconds#how long each burst we fire is
burst separation:seconds#how long we wait between bursts

_field_real.name: weapon damage modifier#what fraction of its normal damage our weapon inflicts (zero = no modifier)

_field_angle.name: projectile error:degrees#error added to every projectile we fire
burst angular velocity:degrees per second#the maximum rate at which we can sweep our fire (zero = unlimited)
maximum error angle:degrees#cap on the maximum angle by which we will miss target (restriction on burst origin radius

_field_block_64.name: flying movement properties
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Think of this as firing point evaluation; how much do we want to weight each of the various vectors affecting our movement in space.

_field_real.name: facing#How much our current movement vector affects our new vector selection.
perturbation#How much random deviation is applied to our vector selection.
volume avoidance#How strongly we avoid our containing volume.
volume perturbation#How strongly we are randomly perturbed by our containing volume.
volume cover#How strongly are we attracted toward cover points.
flocking#How much of a tendancy to flock we have.
target#The weight of our movement towards our current target.
target tail#The weight of our movement intended to keep our target in our tail.

_field_real_bounds.name: area reselect time:seconds#The time bounds on how long we should stay in an area before moving to another area.
idle time:seconds#How long before reselecting a destination while idling.
unsafe cover reselect time:seconds#How long after being exposed in cover before we reselect new cover.
cover heading reselect time:seconds#The frequency at which we pick a new cover point on our current piece of cover.

_field_real.name: max cover search distance:wu#The farthest from ourselves that we will search for cover.
max cover impulse distance:wu#The farthest our target can be from us when decided if we should go to cover.

_field_real_bounds.name: spline cooldown time:wu#The number of seconds we wait after traveling a spline to travel a spline again.

_field_real.name: volume influence distance:wu#How far our volume influences our movement
volume perturbation phase:seconds#What is the frequency of oscillation of our volume perturbation vector
volume bounding distance:wu#How far we are allowed outside our volume before we started being forced to return (must be >= 0)
volume approach distance:wu#If our target is this close to our containing volume, then start attacking him
volume break off distance:wu#While attacking our target, if we get this far outside our containing volume, break off the attack and return home
minimum approach distance:wu#When this close to our target we will drop into the evade behaviour instead

_field_real_bounds.name: collision avoidance range:wu#Zero collision avoidance at the high distance, Max avoidance at the low distance.
evade time:seconds#Bounds on how long we should evade for

_field_real_fraction.name: evade body damage threshold:[0,1]#The recent body damage we should sustain before trying to evade.
evade shield damage threshold:[0,1]#The recent shield damage we should sustain before trying to evade.

_field_real.name: bogey retreat time:seconds#How long we tolerate a bogey in our six, before we retreat back to our area.
bogey retreat distance:wu#How close a bogey has to be before we'll even consider retreating.

_field_real_bounds.name: flock radius:wu#Distance controls for flocking

_field_angle.name: forward follow angle:degrees#How close we must be facing another friend to consider following him during flocking.
behind follow angle:degrees#The angle of the 'cone' behind a friend who I am interested in following that I must be in to consider him during flocking.

_field_real.name: min tailing time:seconds#The minimum amount of time we can be tailing

_field_real_bounds.name: tailing radius:wu#Distance controls for tailing

_field_angle.name: tailing cone angle:degrees#The angle of the 'cone' behind a foe who I am interested in tailing after approaching.

_field_real.name: volume strafe distance:wu#If our target is this close to our containing volume, then start strafing him
strafe min distance:wu#I need to be at least this far away from my target to consider strafing him (2D)
strafe above distance:wu#How high above our target we will aim for when strafing
strafe abort distance:wu#If I get this close to my target, stop strafing and retreat for a bit (2D)
strafe timeout:seconds#How long we go between strafes

_field_angle.name: max descend angle:degrees#The maximum angle at which we can descend.
max ascend angle:degrees#The maximum angle at which we can ascend.
shooting cone angle:degrees#The angle of the shooting cone along the vehicle facing.

_field_real_fraction.name: missile dodge change:percentage#The chance that an AI will dodge incoming missiles.

_field_real.name: ideal missile dodge distance:wu#The ideal distance a trick should take you away from danger.
distance damage outer radius#Considered damaging-outside-range when you START firing from outside this distance
distance damage inner radius#Considered damaging-outside-range when you CONTINUE firing from outside this distance
distance damage time#Damaging tank guy from outside-range for this long causes a morph
distance damage reset time#Damage timer is reset after this long of not damaging him from outside-range

_field_real_bounds.name: throttle distance#Throttle the tank from running (far) to walking (near) across this range of distances. (defaults to 5 and 3)

_field_real.name: protect damage amount#Once current damage reaches this amount, protect your special parts until no recent damage
protect time:seconds#How long should we protect our special parts for?

_field_real.name: spew chance#Probability of throwing up a bunch of infection forms when perimeterising

_field_string_id.name: spew marker#From whence should the infection forms cometh?

_field_real_bounds.name: spew frequency:seconds#Min/max time between spawning each infection form during spew. (defaults to 0.1 and 0.3)

_field_real.name: stealth morph distance threshold#Morphing inside this range causes a tank guy, outside this range causes a ranged fella
stealth morph damage threshold#Percentage of body health he has to be taken down in order to cause a morph

stalk range max#We want to stalk our target from inside this radius

_field_block_64.name: equipment definitions
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Create one of these for each equipment type that you would like a character to be able to use. If you specify a relative drop chance of greater than zero then the character will use and drop this type of equipment with that (relative) chance. If you leave the equipment field empty, then there will be that (relative) chance of using and dropping no equipment at all.

_field_tag_reference_64.name: equipment#The equipment item that is to be usable

_field_real.name: relative drop chance#The relative chance of this equipment being dropped with respect to the other pieces of equipment specified in this block

_field_block_64.name: equipment use
_field_block_64._field_explanation: How should I use this equipment?

_field_short_enum.name: use when^#When should we use this equipment?
use how#How should we use this equipment?

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Given that we have decided to use this equipment, should we do so? (0= always use it, 1= never use it). Heroic skip fraction is the average of normal and legendary chances.

_field_real.name: easy/normal:0-1#
legendary:0-1#

Outer Engage Distance #Close to this distance before picking target-relative flanking position.
Hamstring Delay #Time after last hamstring or melee attack that behavior is banned.
Initiate chance #Chance hamstring is initiated per second.
Max Rush Time #Time to close from flank range to melee charge range.
Melee Attack Time Min #Minimum time for terminal melee attack.
Melee Attack Time Max #Maximum time for terminal melee attack.
Max Charge Range# How far out of area will charge go
order minion charge chance #Chance lackeys are ordered to charge when shield depleted.
order minion charge radius #Radius within which lackeys can be ordered to charge.
minion charge min time #min time for lackey charge.
minion charge max time #max time for lackey charge.

_field_real_bounds.name: Phase To Position distance bounds #Below min, no phase. as distance moves from low to high, chance moves from low to high probabilities
Phase To Position Probability range #As distance moves from low to high, chance to phase moves from low to high values

_field_real_fraction.name: Activation Chance (easy)#Chance to initate per sec on easy difficulty
Activation Chance (normal)#Chance to initate per sec on normal difficulty
Activation Chance (heroic)#Chance to initate per sec on heroic difficulty
Activation Chance (legendary)#Chance to initate per sec on legendary difficulty

_field_real.name: Float Time #Time spent at top of leap.
Float Gravity Scale#Gravity multiplier while floating
Slow descend time #Time spent before full gravity returns - progress through this duration is input to descent grav scale fu.
Jump Target Height #How high to attempt to jump for shot.
Cooldown #Time before this character can gravjump again.
Trigger Distance #How close your enemy has to be to trigger the jump.
Body Vitality Scale for 2-3 Players
Body Vitality Scale for 4 Players
Shield Vitality Scale for 2-3 Players
Shield Vitality Scale for 4 Players
